noun.description: Chiefly Philosophy. Sense perception, observation; (especially in Kantian thought) intuition.
An outlook, attitude, or point of view. Compare earlier "Weltanschauung".

origin: Early 19th century. From German Anschauung looking at, observation, contemplation, perception, intuition, opinion, point of view, outlook, attitude (Old High German anascouwunga, Middle High German anschouwunge; from Old High German anascouwōn (from an- + scouwōn) + -ung).
